Instrument.name: The Light Detection and Ranging (LIDAR) Instrument for Hayabusa
Instrument.description: Light Detection and Ranging (LiDAR) instruments use the time-of-flight measurement of a laser pulse reflected from a surface to determine topography. The Hayabusa LiDAR used a 1064 nm yttrium-aluminum-garnet-neodymium (YAG-Nd) laser. The beamwidth was 0.04 x 0.097 degrees, giving a footprint at 7 km altitude of about 5 x 12 meters.
